channel.title: Ideas, on this
channel.description: Well, my partner and I are creating a server/client, which will handle multiple revisions, and all run off of one server. We are going to be using Databases, and it will all work coherently. They will share the char files, every data on them (Items on higher revisions won't load on the lower revisions obviously, but you should get my point). Anyways this is not the question that I have. We are trying to decide how to handle the structure. How packet handling, etc will be done. It should be (in his words) "we need a system which is completely based on stuff without any connection to a client..". In other words no client needed. The system will be using a library to handle most everything, however packet handling and such we are trying to come up with ways to do it. Any advice would be nice, and no dumbass responses.

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:38, topic:431028”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901432#msg3901432 date=1327801539]

No, you changed gears to talk about your project, and I was asking questions about them being all at once, because that’s what I thought you were talking about too

I agree to disagree with any sort disagreeing stance that you are indeed a moron. Much better baddy?
[/quote]Well if we’re putting our opinions out into the open, I may as well say that I think you’re puffed up idiot that rewrites already developed code and ideas as your own genius developments, then posts them just to brag knowing that nobody else will use them. Oh, and that you try to makes simple things sound complicated when you explain them to further boost your ego and make people think more highly of you. And I agree to disagree with any disagreements of the above.[/quote]

My ego is proportionally equal to my client knowledge, get over it.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas, on this
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:431028”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901419#msg3901419 date=1327800985]

[/end quote train]

It’s not hard to think about on a repository standpoint, but from a players standpoint it’s kinda sad. Basically ruins the entire point of having the server support multiple revisions, because the interaction is limited to people that support the same content as you, and you may as well be hosting different servers (or have one that can change on start up, like I said earlier)

@ EDIT - You’re the one that’s not understanding what I’m saying, and going off on all the stupid tangents…

I think you are being the moron in this situation.

change on start up

Congrats you finally understand what I said one page ago.
[/quote][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=533702.msg3901386#msg3901386 date=1327798472]
When I think of things like this, the only useful options I can think of are:

Limiting the high protocol clients to low protocol content, allowing only discrepancies in graphics quality/UI

Having the server chose ONE revision on startup
[/quote][/quote]

That’s what the data collection is for. Before the server started up and you knew what revision it was going to run you’d run through the plugins and pull from a server all the required data for the server to function properly. Ex: Npc definitions, landscape data, object definitions.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas, on this
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:26, topic:431028”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901408#msg3901408 date=1327800007]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=533702.msg3901407#msg3901407 date=1327799921]

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901405#msg3901405 date=1327799782]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=533702.msg3901403#msg3901403 date=1327799671]

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901400#msg3901400 date=1327799404]

And what would that system do?

Believe or not I have a notebook of ideas on this because this has been my big project for the last six months. Without getting into major systems we could talk about the general objective? It’s very complex and my current work right now is data collection of all the clients. I studied the clients for hooks the last month and compiled a nice long list of ways to analyze packets and protocols which is my next step after I finish my current scripting project.
[/quote]You missed my question. What would the system do? You’d have to analyze the packets and protocol for anything like this, but I mean quite literally, what would the end product be of your ‘system’? Would it black out those areas, or what?

Well the whole objective of this project is to create multi revisional server? The customer would download a little package plugin file and start it up, and that’s it. Also we were working towards creating a very easy to use plugin system and a ‘RSBuddy’ approach to RSPS but that is very far off in the future.
[/quote]… You missed it again. What is the end product? What will the PLAYER see? You were saying that you can fix the discrepancies between the revisions, so what would that fix entail?

You are oblivious. It’s a server, what do you think they will see? It’s ONE SERVER that runs ONE REVISION but that server can easily CHANGE REVISIONS in a click of the mouse.

I don’t care what the player sees I care about what my customer sees.
[/quote]We were talking about the server discrepancies, when a person is playing the game, and how we would handle them. You said your system would handle this… didn’t you?

The topic changed, read and keep up.
[/quote]So you were only replying to the crashing part? Because I was talking about the part before that, like the map differences. The crashing part is pretty obvious, as that’s the entire point of having handlers for different protocols. I’m not sure what you would even need ‘hooks’ or ‘massive lists’ for, the protocols are all already out there.

Why the hell would I go out and write a package for every server when I could have a program do it for me?
[/quote]Because you just spent all the time finding the hooks for each protocol, why the hell would that be faster than just using protocols already made and adapting it to an interface…

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=533702.msg3901412#msg3901412 date=1327800160]

this idea is a shit idea from a player’s perspective but could be fun from the engineering perspective. stop bitching faggots

I’m in it for the money. Imagine people downloading a castle wars plugin off a plugin repository and it installing into their server without having to worry about moving it to a higher revision.
[/quote]What about a soul wars plugin? That’s my point, and what zyle was talking about, how would you handle stuff in lower revisions that aren’t in the higher revisions, or vice versa?[/quote]

Just have a little revision number tagged onto the content? >690 etc? Obviously plugins geared to support more revisions will make more so content developers will work towards support so that their product is used on many revisions instead of one.

How is that hard to think about?

Don’t be stupid David. The networking for all the clients is the same, the file system changes once in a blue moon, the packet system is still the same and they have a wrapper class for the packet id and size as of earlish RuneTek 4. It’s a company and changing things dramatically takes money and time. Be smart about this.

Read full topic

You are oblivious. It’s a server, what do you think they will see? It’s ONE SERVER that runs ONE REVISION but that server can easily CHANGE REVISIONS in a click of the mouse.

I don’t care what the player sees I care about what my customer sees.
